page.title: 09RECREATION ACTIVITIES
page.content: Children of Beenham School enjoy many leisure activities- Brownies /Guides (Victory Hall);Cubs /Scouts in Bradfield; Cycling, rollerskating, judo, skateboarding, saturday music school(Newbury);Playing musical instruments; Horse riding; Swimming; Badminton; Watching television and using computers. The more unusual are snooker played by Simon, sailing enjoyed by Stuart who says he likes the way it dips in the wind. Alice likes her pottery club and likes break-dancing. Others include flying model planes, working on the farm and beating for pheasant. Jayne O'Mahoney has very little leisure time. Dancing and singing have earned her the opportunity to play in the Royal Shakespear Company's production of Les Miserables at the Barbican as a young cosette.
